data.event: Founded in 1830 by European Americans, the area was originally known as Salem.
In 1839 Salem was designated the seat of the newly formed Dade County.

event.title: April 27, 2011, an EF-3 tornado with winds of 150 mph (240 km/h) hit

data.event: On April 27, 2011, an EF-3 tornado with winds of 150 mph (240 km/h) hit the city, causing significant damage and loss of life.

event.title: was not officially identified and marked with a monument until 2008

data.event: Although he was considered one of the seminal writers of Southern humor and greatly influenced the literary works of Mark Twain, William Faulkner, and Flannery O'Connor, his grave was not officially identified and marked with a monument until 2008.
